title: Travis CI builds are failing due to Travis JDK instability
body:
E.g. https://travis-ci.org/jhy/jsoup/jobs/554449301

Travis isn't installing JDK 9 correctly now, leading to failures. It's half installing JDK 11?

```
Installing openjdk9
$ export JAVA_HOME=~/openjdk9
$ export PATH="$JAVA_HOME/bin:$PATH"
$ ~/bin/install-jdk.sh --target "/home/travis/openjdk9" --workspace "/home/travis/.cache/install-jdk" --feature "9" --license "GPL" --cacerts
Ignoring license option: GPL -- using GPLv2+CE by default
install-jdk.sh 2019-07-03
Variables:
  feature = 9
  license = GPL
       os = linux-x64 // os_name=linux os_arch=x64
      url = https://api.adoptopenjdk.net/v2/binary/releases/openjdk9?type=jdk&os=linux&arch=x64&release=latest&heap_size=normal&openjdk_impl=hotspot
   status = 302
Downloading JDK from https://api.adoptopenjdk.net/v2/binary/releases/openjdk9?type=jdk&os=linux&arch=x64&release=latest&heap_size=normal&openjdk_impl=hotspot...
Using custom target: /home/travis/openjdk9
openjdk version "11.0.2" 2019-01-15
OpenJDK Runtime Environment 18.9 (build 11.0.2+9)
OpenJDK 64-Bit Server VM 18.9 (build 11.0.2+9, mixed mode)
git.checkout
0.87s$ git clone --depth=50 --branch=master https://github.com/jhy/jsoup.git jhy/jsoup
Cloning into 'jhy/jsoup'...
remote: Enumerating objects: 991, done.
remote: Counting objects: 100% (991/991), done.
remote: Cremote: Compressing objects: 100% (446/446), done.
remote: Total 991 (delta 444), reused 833 (delta 377), pack-reused 0
Receiving objects: 100% (991/991), 493.97 KiB | 7.97 MiB/s, done.
Resolving deltas: 100% (444/444), done.
$ cd jhy/jsoup
$ git checkout -qf a9439f0c503ac8e0f009a0ec39f8bff1a6271d51
cache.1
Setting up build cache
$ export CASHER_DIR=${TRAVIS_HOME}/.casher
0.28s$ Installing caching utilities
0.00s2.04sattempting to download cache archive
fetching master/cache-linux-xenial-e3b0c44298fc1c149afbf4c8996fb92427ae41e4649b934ca495991b7852b855--jdk-openjdk9.tgz
found cache
0.00s1.68sadding /home/travis/.m2 to cache
$ java -Xmx32m -version
openjdk version "11.0.2" 2019-01-15
OpenJDK Runtime Environment 18.9 (build 11.0.2+9)
OpenJDK 64-Bit Server VM 18.9 (build 11.0.2+9, mixed mode)
$ javac -J-Xmx32m -version
javac 11.0.2
3.02s$ mvn install -DskipTests=true -Dmaven.javadoc.skip=true -B -V
The JAVA_HOME environment variable is not defined correctly
This environment variable is needed to run this program
NB: JAVA_HOME should point to a JDK not a JRE
The command "eval mvn install -DskipTests=true -Dmaven.javadoc.skip=true -B -V " failed. Retrying, 2 of 3.
```
